clinical_study.brief_title: Postural Changes in Lung Volumes in Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Weight Loss on Postural Changes in Pulmonary Function : a Longitudinal Study in Morbidly Obese to Obese Subjects Following Gastroplasty

lead_sponsor.agency: Association pour la Formation du Personnel à la Medecine d'Urgence

clinical_study.source: Association pour la Formation du Personnel à la Medecine d'Urgence

brief_summary.textblock: Postural changes are known to affect normal lung volumes. A reduction in sitting to supine functional residual capacity (FRC) is well-described in non-obese subjects adopting a supine position. However, postural changes in lung volumes in the obese require further exploration. We aimed to longitudinally address the effects of weight loss on postural changes in lung volumes and pulmonary function, in obesity. We tested the hypothesis that supine reduction in FRC would be absent in morbid obesity and recovered upon weight loss.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and one year after bariatric surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and after bariatric surgery

arm_group.description: Consecutive morbidly obese adults (BMI over or equal to 40 kg/m2) scheduled for bariatric surgery were prospectively recruited.Subjects with respiratory and cardiac history (asthma, Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, heart failure) were excluded.

intervention.intervention_name: Postural change in lung volumes: sitting to Supine
intervention.description: Pulmonary function and arterial blood gases were assessed both prior to and after weight loss as part of pre-operative and 12-month follow-up evaluations. Pulmonary function tests were performed both in the sitting and then in the supine position.

study_pop.textblock: Twelve morbidly obese adults (BMI over or equal to 40 kg/m2) scheduled for bariatric surgery at the Montpellier university hospital were recruited. They were 3 men and 9 women.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subjects scheduled for bariatric surgery (BMI over or equal to 40 kg/m2)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with respiratory and cardiac history (asthma, COPD, heart failure) were excluded.
